message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.SE, cs.OS, cs.NI 

The paper discusses the design and implementation of a Linux Kernel Module (LKM) for building and hardening High Interaction Honeypots. This topic falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) as honeypots are used for detecting and gathering information about ongoing intrusions. The paper also discusses the manipulation of system calls, which falls under the category of operating systems (cs.OS). The use of a kernel module also falls under the category of systems and control (cs.SY). The paper also discusses the use of a high-level language for configuring the module, which falls under the category of software engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the paper discusses the use of Apate as a building block for upcoming High Interaction Honeypots, which falls under the category of networking and internet architecture (cs.NI).
